info.name: API Octorenov
info.description: API pour la gestion des jobs et offres de la plateforme Octorenov

request.description:
### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `/api/jobs`
    
- Query Parameters:
    
    - status: 1
        

### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response body includes the following structure:

- totalItems: The total number of items in the response.
    
- member: An array of job objects, each containing id, title, description, status, createdAt, updatedAt, and customer details.
    
- view: Contains information about the view.
    
- search: Contains information about the search template and mapping.
    

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like

response.name: Pending jobs
response.body:

                "variable": "status[]",
                "property": "status",
                "required": false
            }
        ]
    }
}

request.description:
### Retrieve Job Details

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve details of a specific job.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `/api/jobs/{id}`
    

#### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response will have the following structure:

- `id` (number): The numeric ID of the job.
    
- `title` (string): The title of the job.
    
- `description` (string): The description of the job.
    
- `status` (number): The status of the job.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the job was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the job was last updated.
    
- `customer` (object): An object containing customer details
    

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like

response.name: A job
response.body:
{
    "@context": "/api/contexts/Job",
    "@id": "/api/jobs/1",
    "@type": "Job",
    "id": 1,
    "title": "Epidemiologist",
    "description": "Aperiam molestiae molestiae qui magni accusamus ipsa asperiores voluptatem.",
    "status": 1,
    "createdAt": "2024-10-31T12:01:39+00:00",
    "updatedAt": "2024-10-31T12:01:39+00:00",
    "customer": {
        "@id": "/api/customers/5",
        "@type": "Customer",
        "name": "Sheridan Kertzmann II"
    }
}

request.description:
### Add Job

This endpoint allows you to add a new job by providing the job title, description, and customer details.

#### Request

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `/api/jobs`
    

##### Body

- `title`: (string) The title of the job.
    
- `description`: (string) A description of the job.
    
- `customer`: (string) The customer's API endpoint.
    

#### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response body includes the following structure:

- `id`: (integer) The ID of the newly created job.
    
- `title`: (string) The title of the job.
    
- `description`: (string) A description of the job.
    
- `status`: (integer) The status of the job.
    
- `createdAt`: (string) The timestamp of when the job was created.
    
- `updatedAt`: (string) The timestamp of when the job was last updated.
    
- `customer`: (object) An object containing customer details including their name.
    

Note: The actual customer details will be returned in the response.

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like

response.name: New job
response.body:
{
    "@context": "/api/contexts/Job",
    "@id": "/api/jobs/7",
    "@type": "Job",
    "id": 7,
    "title": "Gardening Assistance",
    "description": "Looking for help with garden maintenance.",
    "status": 1,
    "createdAt": "2024-11-02T01:44:49+00:00",
    "updatedAt": "2024-11-02T01:44:49+00:00",
    "customer": {
        "@id": "/api/customers/1",
        "@type": "Customer",
        "name": "Miss Providenci Berge DVM"
    }
}

request.description:
### Get Offer Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific offer.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `/api/offers/{id}`
    

#### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response body includes the following structure:

- `id` (number): The numeric ID of the offer.
    
- `amount` (number): The amount of the offer.
    
- `status` (number): The status of the offer.
    
- `createdAt` (string): The timestamp when the offer was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string): The timestamp when the offer was last updated.
    
- `job` (object): An object containing job details
    
- `jobber` (object): An object containing jobber details
    

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like

### Create New Offer

This endpoint allows the client to create a new offer by sending a POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `/api/jobs`
    

##### Body

- `amount` (number) - The amount for the offer.
    
- `job` (string) - The URL of the job associated with the offer.
    
- `jobber` (string) - The URL of the jobber associated with the offer.
    

Example:

``` json
{
  "amount": 150,
  "job": "/api/jobs/1",
  "jobber": "/api/jobbers/1"
}

 ```

#### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response body includes the following structure:

- `id` (number) - The unique identifier of the offer.
    
- `amount` (number) - The amount of the offer.
    
- `status` (number) - The status of the offer.
    
- `createdAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the offer was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the offer was last updated.
    
- `job` (string) - The URL of the job associated with the offer.
    
- `jobber` (string) - The URL of the jobber associated with the offer.
    

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like

### Update Offer Status

This endpoint is used to update the status of a specific offer.

#### Request

- Method: PUT
    
- URL: /api/offers/{id}
    
- Body:
    
    - `status` (integer): The new status of the offer.
        

#### Response

The API returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and Content-Type of application/ld+json.

The response body includes the following structure:

- `id` (number) - The unique identifier of the offer.
    
- `amount` (number) - The amount of the offer.
    
- `status` (number) - The status of the offer.
    
- `createdAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the offer was created.
    
- `updatedAt` (string) - The timestamp of when the offer was last updated.
    
- `job` (string) - The URL of the job associated with the offer.
    
- `jobber` (string) - The URL of the jobber associated with the offer.
    

You can look at the example to see what a succesfull response will look like
